name.text: 27.3.4.8 prism CoM and moment of inertia task

questiontext.text:
For the solid prism shown below

[[jsxgraph width="400px" height="300px" ]] const board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('jxgbox', { boundingbox: [-5, 5, 5, -5], axis: false, showNavigation: false }); // Axes points const X = board.create('point', [0, 4], {visible: false, fixed: true}); const Y = board.create('point', [4, 0], {visible: false, fixed: true}); const Z = board.create('point', [-3, -3], {visible: false, fixed: true}); // Back triangle const O = board.create('point', [0, 0], {visible: false, fixed: true}); const A = board.create('point', [1.5, 0], {visible: false, fixed: true}); const B = board.create('point', [0, 2], {visible: false, fixed: true}); // Front triangle const D = board.create('point', [-2, 0], {visible: false, fixed: true}); const E = board.create('point', [-2, -2], {visible: false, fixed: true}); const F = board.create('point', [-0.5, -2], {visible: false, fixed: true}); // Axes with labels board.create('arrow', [O, X], {strokeColor: 'black', name: 'X', withLabel: false,fontSize: 12}); board.create('arrow', [O, Y], {strokeColor: 'black', name: 'Y', withLabel: false,fontSize: 12}); board.create('arrow', [O, Z], {strokeColor: 'black', name: 'Z', withLabel: false,fontSize: 12}); // Create lines for the back triangle board.create('line', [O, A], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); board.create('line', [O, B], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); board.create('line', [A, B], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); // Create lines for the front triangle board.create('line', [D, E], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); board.create('line', [E, F], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); board.create('line', [F, D], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); // Create lines for the sides of the prism board.create('line', [A, F], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); board.create('line', [B, D], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); board.create('line', [O, E], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); // Add other labels board.create('text', [-1.2, -2.3, '\\(x = {#aa#}\\)'], {fontSize: 12,fixed: true}); board.create('text', [4.2, 0, '\\(x\\)'], {fontSize: 12,fixed: true}); board.create('text', [0, 4.2, '\\(y\\)'], {fontSize: 12,fixed: true}); board.create('text', [-3.2, -3.2, '\\(z\\)'], {fontSize: 12,fixed: true}); board.create('text', [1, 1, '\\(y + z = 1\\)'], {fontSize: 12,fixed: true}); board.create('text', [0.1, 2.1, '\\(1\\)'], {fontSize: 12,fixed: true}); board.create('text', [1.6, 0.2, '\\(1\\)'], {fontSize: 12,fixed: true}); board.create('text', [-2.4, -2.0, '\\({#aa#}\\)'], {fontSize: 12,fixed: true}); [[/jsxgraph]]

Find:

  1. the coordinates of the centre of mass (input as a list): [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]
  2. the moment of inertia about the \(x\)- , \(y\)- and \(z\)-axes (input as a list in terms of M): [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]

generalfeedback.text:
1. The \(x\), \(y\) and \(z\) coordinates of the centre of mass of a solid of constant density are given by \[\displaystyle \overline{x} = \frac{\displaystyle\int x\;\mathrm{d}V}{\displaystyle\int \mathrm{d}V}\qquad\quad\overline{y} = \frac{\displaystyle\int y\;\mathrm{d}V}{\displaystyle\int \mathrm{d}V} \qquad\quad \overline{z} = \frac{\displaystyle\int z\;dV}{\displaystyle\int \mathrm{d}V} \] Let us find \(\displaystyle\int \mathrm{d}V.\) \begin{align*} \int \mathrm{d}V &= \int_{z=0}^1 \int_{y=0}^{1-z} \int_{x=0}^{@aa@} \;\mathrm{d}x \,\mathrm{d}y \,\mathrm{d}z \\ &= \int_{z=0}^1 \int_{y=0}^{1-z} \bigg[ x\bigg]_0^{@aa@} \;\mathrm{d}y \,\mathrm{d}z = \int_{z=0}^1 \int_{y=0}^{1-z} {@aa@} \;\mathrm{d}y \,\mathrm{d}z \\ &= \int_{z=0}^1 \bigg[ {@fbI12@}\bigg]_{y=0}^{1-z} \;\mathrm{d}z = \int_{z=0}^1 \left( {@I12@} \right) \;\mathrm{d}z \\ &= \bigg[{@fbI13@} \bigg]_0^1 = {@I13@} \end{align*} The numerator of the expression for \(\overline{x}\) is given by \begin{align*} \int x\;\mathrm{d}V &= \int_{z=0}^1 \int_{y=0}^{1-z} \int_{x=0}^{@aa@} x \;\mathrm{d}x \,\mathrm{d}y \,\mathrm{d}z = \int_{z=0}^1 \int_{y=0}^{1-z} \left[{@fbIx1@} \right]_0^{@aa@} \;\mathrm{d}y \,\mathrm{d}z = \int_{z=0}^1 \int_{y=0}^{1-z} {@Ix1@} \;\mathrm{d}y \,\mathrm{d}z \\ &= \int_{z=0}^1 \bigg[ {@fbIx2@}\bigg]_{y=0}^{1-z} \;\mathrm{d}z = \int_{z=0}^1 \left( {@Ix2@} \right) \;\mathrm{d}z = \int_{z=0}^1 \left( {@fbIx3@} \right) \;\mathrm{d}z = {@Ix3@} \end{align*} So, \(\overline{x} = {@Ix3@}\div{@I13@} = {@ta1x@}\). By similar integration it can be shown that \(\bar y={@ta1y@}, \ \bar z={@ta1z@}\).
  2. The moment of inertia about the \(x-\)axis, \(I_x\) is given by \(\displaystyle I_x = \rho \int_V (y^2 + z^2)\; dV\) which for the solid under consideration is given by \begin{align*} I_x &= \rho \int_{x=0}^{@aa@} \int_{y=0}^1 \int_{z=0}^{1-y}(y^2 + z^2)\;\mathrm{d}z\,\mathrm{d}y\,\mathrm{d}x \\ &= \rho \int_{x=0}^{@aa@} \int_{y=0}^1 \left(y^2 - y^3 + \frac{(1-y)^3}{3}\right) \;\mathrm{d}y\,\mathrm{d}x \\ &= \rho \int_{x=0}^{@aa@} \frac{1}{6} \;\mathrm{d}x = {@I2x3@}\rho \end{align*} Now, the mass \(M\) of the solid is given by \(M = \rho \times {\rm Volume} = {@I13@} \rho\) (where the volume is found in part a) so \(\qquad\displaystyle I_x = {@I2x3*rho@} = {@I2x3@} \rho \times \frac{M}{{@I13*rho@}} = {@ta2x@} \) Similarly, the moment of inertia about the \(y-\)axis, \(I_y\) is given by \(\displaystyle I_y = \rho \int_V (x^2 + z^2)\; \mathrm{d}V\) which for the solid under consideration is given by \begin{eqnarray*} I_y &= \rho \int_{x=0}^{@aa@} \int_{y=0}^1 \int_{z=0}^{1-y}(x^2 + z^2)\;\mathrm{d}z\,\mathrm{d}y\,\mathrm{d}x \\ &= \rho \int_{x=0}^{@aa@} \int_{y=0}^1 \left(x^2(1-y) + \frac{(1-y)^3}{3}\right) \;\mathrm{d}y\,\mathrm{d}x \\ &= \rho \int_{x=0}^{@aa@} \left( \frac{1}{2} x^2 + \frac{1}{12} \right) \;\mathrm{d}x = {@I2y3@}\rho \end{eqnarray*} and so \(\ \displaystyle I_y = {@I2y3*rho@} = {@I2y3*rho@} \times \frac{M}{ {@I13*rho@}} = {@ta2y@} \). Finally, by symmetry, \(I_z = I_y = {@ta2z@}\).
